course.title: Information Technology Career Preparation
course.catalogDescription: In this course students will begin applying their MWSU education towards building a career in IT. Students will learn how to navigate a career path in IT, explore alternative career paths, and explore opportunities for continuing education and professional development. Students will develop application materials and attempt entrance, exit, and / or certification exams in preparation for graduation, applying to jobs, and applying to graduate schools.

objectives.objective: Determine what types of jobs in IT best match their short and long term career and professional development goals
Locate and navigate resources for finding IT jobs in their desired location
Effectively communicate their skill set and value as an employee to potential employers through letters, resumes, networking, interviews, and other means
Locate and utilize resources for continuing education and professional development to gain or improve specific skillsets in IT or transition in to other career fields (ex. Law)
Prepare effectively for certification exams, assessments, and technical interviews

outline.topic: Emerging and popular IT skillsets and technologies
Communication Developing IT resumes Developing IT cover letters Developing a project portfolio Applying to graduate schools Developing a web and social media presence
Networking Professional organizations Conferences, job fairs, and other professional gatherings
Preparing for entrance, exit, and certification exams
